TITLE: Implementing Server Client with Supabase in Remix DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the getSupabaseServerClient function to interact with Supabase from server-side code. This example demonstrates querying tasks from a database table. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/kits/remix-supabase-turbo/data-fetching/supabase-clients.mdx#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { LoaderFunctionArgs } from '@remix-run/node'; import { getSupabaseServerClient } from '@kit/supabase/server-client'; export async function loader(args: LoaderFunctionArgs) { const supabase = getSupabaseServerClient() const { data, error } = await supabase.from('tasks').select('*'); return { data, }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Browser Client with Supabase in Remix DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the useSupabase hook to interact with Supabase from the browser client. This example shows a simple component with a sign-out button implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/kits/remix-supabase-turbo/data-fetching/supabase-clients.mdx#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useSupabase } from '@kit/supabase/hooks/use-supabase'; export default function Home() { const supabase = useSupabase() return (

Supabase Browser Client

) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Server Admin Client with Supabase in Remix DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the getSupabaseServerAdminClient function for admin-level operations. This client should only be used when admin privileges are required, such as bypassing row-level security. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/kits/remix-supabase-turbo/data-fetching/supabase-clients.mdx#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { LoaderFunctionArgs } from '@remix-run/node'; import { getSupabaseServerAdminClient } from '@kit/supabase/server-admin-client'; export async function loader(args: LoaderFunctionArgs) { const supabase = getSupabaseServerAdminClient() const { data, error } = await supabase.from('tasks').select('*'); return { data, }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Markdown Files for Remix Supabase Turbo Kit DESCRIPTION: Command to generate Markdown files specifically for the Remix Supabase Turbo kit. This ensures a more precise context for the chosen kit. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node index.js kits/remix-supabase-turbo ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Markdown Files for Next.js Supabase Turbo Kit DESCRIPTION: Command to generate Markdown files for the Next.js Supabase Turbo kit. This creates LLM-friendly context files in the dist folder. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node index.js kits/next-supabase-turbo ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Markdown Files for Courses DESCRIPTION: Command to generate Markdown files for Makerkit courses. This creates LLM-friendly context files in the dist folder. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node index.js courses ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Word Count for Generated Markdown Files DESCRIPTION: Command to generate Markdown files with a custom word count per file. This example sets the limit to 4000 words per file for all kits. SOURCE: https://github.com/makerkit/documentation.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node index.js kits 4000 ```
